result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Remove Anti-Theft Device (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(f).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Tony Williams in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 and strike the repeater allegation and counts 2 and 3 and dismissed and read-in.  Court imposed the following sentence:

60 days jail, consecutive to his present sentence
DNA sample if not already imposed
$243.00 court costs
$200.00 DNA surcharge
$10.00 DRGOD surcharge
Court costs and surcharges to be converted into civil judgements upon non-payment
filed, to be produced from Dodge Correctional

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery in court.   Defendant Tony Williams did not appear.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matters have been resolved, but the defendant was not produced from Dodge Correctional. Court sets for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Detention received and filed.
Detainer placed at Dodge Correctional Inst.

Court grants the request and new counsel to be appointed. Attorney Rosario is no longer counsel.
